item.title: Movement and Game Mechanics
item.description: In the world of video games, game mechanics are the building blocks that make up a player’s experience. They are the rules, systems, and interactions that define how a game works and how players engage with it.

item.title: Setting up Monogame for development
item.description: Before any Game could be implemented, there is a setup for the development environment to do. Of course, you could just follow the Setup-Guide at MonoGame’s website.

item.title: The software you need!
item.description: As we went with Monogame as our Game Engine, we need a lot of external tools around it, as Monogame itself only comes with the MGCB-Editor as an image preprocessor.
